subject: p16622813
Findings: Cardiomediastinal contours are stable in appearance. Lungs remain hyperinflated. A subtle area of increased opacity has developed at the left lung base and could reflect acute aspiration, developing pneumonia, or atelectasis. Other findings including postoperative appearance of the right hemithorax and enlarged hilar structures due to a combination of enlarged pulmonary arteries and right hilar lymphadenopathy appear unchanged since the recent chest radiograph.
